author: Mike Vilensky
title: New York State’s Budget: Who Won, Who Lost?
text:
ALBANY—Gov. Andrew Cuomo and state lawmakers passed a $168 billion budget over the weekend, a spending package that slaps a surcharge on Uber rides in Manhattan, seeks to protect state taxpayers from the federal overhaul and provides new funding for New York City’s public housing.
But the plan left out some long-sought measures advocates had pushed for, including ethics laws and new spending oversight, an extension of the statute of limitations for child sex-abuse victims and more traffic-safety cameras.
